intro: Leucopogon petiolaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves and is often found in heathlands and open forests. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to coastal and sandy environments. Leucopogon petiolaris plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
